channel.title: [ Help ] Opening .jar Files
channel.description:
[u][b]Problem:[/b][/u] I get this error every time I open a .jar file (tom's cache suite). [img]http://i1107.photobucket.com/albums/h387/D_I_N_G__O/Untitled-1.png[/img] Sorry that its faded it only stays open for less then a second. I have the default program set the to java application via Program Files>Java>jre6>bin>java In the picture it says on the top of the cmd
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_23\bin\java.exe
Is that something to do with a classpath? Anything helps!

item.title: [ Help ] Opening .jar Files
item.dc:creator: @c_o_l_d c o l d
item.description:
@c_o_l_d wrote:

Fixed, just had to uninstall and reinstall java

Read full topic

item.title: [ Help ] Opening .jar Files
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“c o l d, post:8, topic:406852”]Link Please?

These are the two files I’ve looked through:
http://uppit.com/jo2tyiq7hghs/Cache_Suite.rar
http://uppit.com/v/GVBQ3AAR[/quote]

Odd, I can’t seem to find nuke-net Q_Q

I don’t have the suite on this computer (or at this house) either, sorry

Read full topic

item.title: [ Help ] Opening .jar Files
item.dc:creator: @c_o_l_d c o l d
item.description:
@c_o_l_d wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:7, topic:406852”][quote author=c o l d link=topic=503841.msg3686380#msg3686380 date=1311877357]

i think its saying it cant find the main method. so make a batch file like

java - cp ./suite.jar "the main class goes here"
pause

idk if that will work, i havent used cmd in a while.

The funny part is, there’s already a batch file made to run Tom’s Cache Suite. >.>
He should be able to look through the folder and find what will help him easily.

I could not find 1 batch file in the whole folder…
[/quote]
There should have been a batch file in the main directory. In the download on nukenet, there is a batch file.[/quote]

Link Please?

These are the two files I’ve looked through:
http://uppit.com/jo2tyiq7hghs/Cache_Suite.rar
http://uppit.com/v/GVBQ3AAR

Read full topic

i think its saying it cant find the main method. so make a batch file like

java - cp ./suite.jar "the main class goes here"
pause

idk if that will work, i havent used cmd in a while.

The funny part is, there’s already a batch file made to run Tom’s Cache Suite. >.>
He should be able to look through the folder and find what will help him easily.
[/quote]

I could not find 1 batch file in the whole folder…[/quote]
There should have been a batch file in the main directory. In the download on nukenet, there is a batch file.

item.title: [ Help ] Opening .jar Files
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

[quote=“c o l d, post:1, topic:406852”]Problem: I get this error every time I open a .jar file (tom’s cache suite).


Sorry that its faded it only stays open for less then a second.
I have the default program set the to java application via Program Files>Java>jre6>bin>java

In the picture it says on the top of the cmd [quote]C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_23\bin\java.exe[/quote]
Is that something to do with a classpath?

Anything helps![/quote]

i think its saying it cant find the main method. so make a batch file like

java - cp ./suite.jar "the main class goes here"
pause

idk if that will work, i havent used cmd in a while.

Read full topic

item.title: [ Help ] Opening .jar Files
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

gravenfire23:

Why are you opening jars with toms cache quite?

He’s trying to open tom’s cache suite (which is a jar).

I’m randomly throwing this out there, but it may be because you are running the jar and not the batch file made for it, and the batch file may contain some necessary/vital arguments to make it run.

Read full topic
